website_summaries.verdict: A premium digital handheld scanner that is proven to perform.
pros: Free-form memory organization makes it easy to optimize memory usage
Allows you to arrange and scan objects according to preference
Delivers instant access to frequencies used by storm spotter networks
cons: First-time users sometimes struggle to program the scanner

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time and money
customer_reviews.text: Radio was to have active programming included. Doesn’t pickup anything. You’ll get more action from an app on your iPhone then you ever will with this. Don’t waste your money. Radio arrived with a scratched face, instructions are well laid out, but the included firmware and software were out of date, tried repeatedly to update both with no success. I’ll never buy another product made by Whistler
customer_reviews.author: Evan Weightman

customer_reviews.title: It's an older design sir but it checks out.
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is really rough on these. Plan to use disposable batteries like alkalines all the time. Or if you use NiMH batteries use an external charger. The built in charger will take a week or more to charge NiMH batteries. Also this unit uses old style linear regulators so it uses more power then it should. ~250ma all the time, at all voltages. Works great though!
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Was a descent radio.
customer_reviews.text: Have had this scanner for 6 months and the antenna just broke off the top of the scanner. I have not dropped it once and always use it on the desk. I just went to use the radio and antenna fell out. Screw is stuck inside....
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Used to work, now it's deaf
customer_reviews.text: So when I first got this TRX-1 I was able to get it programmed. Then we moved and I loaded the local channels I wanted to listen to. Now it's deaf. I mean they say is does P25 phase 2, but mine is a boat anchor. Heck my Unidens program much easier then this thing. Don't waste your money on this radio spend it on one that works like ANY of the Unidens.
customer_reviews.author: Kd7ctv

customer_reviews.title: THIS THING WORKS AS EXPECTED
customer_reviews.text: IT TOOK ME A WHILE TO GET THE PROGRAMMING DOWN BUT SOMEONE THAT HAS COMPUTER SKILLS WOULD HAVE NO PROBLEM. MISSOURI CHANGED TO THE MOSWIN DIGITAL SYSTEM P25 PHASE ONE AND TWO SYSTEMS AND I WAS NO LONGER ABLE TO MONITOR THE STATE POLICE ALSO MY COUNTY CHANGED. WE LIVE IN THE COUNTRY AND I COULD NO LONGER HEAR WHAT WHAT IS GOING ON AROUND US. WE HAVE GOOD SHERIFFS DEPARTMENT BUT AT ANY GIVEN TIME THERE ARE NOT ENOUGH DEPUTIES TO COVER THE WHOLE COUNTY AND WE NEED TO KNOW WHAT IS GOING ON IN THE AREA. THE BAD ELEMENTS HAVE COME TO THE COUNTRY AND THIS SCANNER HELPS KEEP MY FAMILY SAFE
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Obermann

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to program , not user friendly
customer_reviews.text: I found nothing but frustration trying to program this scanner , if you use the zip code programming you end up with tons of channels you don’t want. The software used to program is completely not user friendly and pretty frustrating as well. The speaker on this scanner is way to quiet. For the money I would pass on it.
customer_reviews.author: Thundershots

customer_reviews.title: Really enjoying this scanner
customer_reviews.text: I have been scanning since the early 70's so I've used a wide variety of scanning receivers. While there are things I would change on the TRX-1, my opinion is that it's the best scanner on the market at this time for less than $1,000. By "best," I mean has the most features and receives the most different types of transmissions right out of the box or with a quick, free upgrade. That being said, it is not a scanner for beginners. But for anyone who is up to speed on object oriented scanners and how to program them, it will be easy to get going with a TRX-1.
customer_reviews.author: Highmaster2

customer_reviews.title: Like New ! , Great Little Scanner , USED "BUT" Not Damaged !
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the Box , this Little Radio Programed Just like it was meant to ! Volume Sounds Great nice and Loud its Display is nice an brite with a nice brite white light background making this Hand Held Radio Display Very Easy to See day or night ! and the AA Alkaline 0r AA Rechargable Batteries Last pretty long as well, so if anybody wants a great little Scanner this Model is a great Item to buy ! Rory S.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I will not buy another Whistler
customer_reviews.text: Every time I tried to program this radio using my computer and Whistler software this thing it lost the firmware. I would go to Whistler’s website and reinstall the firmware. If I had it searching that worked, but every time I tried the computer programming I got this error message. “Firmware not installed” I sent it back and purchased a Uniden, which is what I usually buy.
customer_reviews.author: Marc J

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: The included instructions did not match what the unit did when I turned it on. I could not find a you-tube video that matched this units behavior either so I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Paul P

customer_reviews.title: Whistler 1040, works great
customer_reviews.text: There is a learning curve to both down loading from the web and programming manually. I have only had it a few days but it performs very well. I have called the help line twice and the support was great. It was sticking on a channel I manually loaded and they said to adjust the squelch. That fixed it. The digital channels are clear and strong. Lots of activity in this area. I am excited to explore more features and programming options. Very pleased with this purchase. Whistler tech support is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Rono

customer_reviews.title: So far I've only been able to use the quick method of zip code and it worked fine in one location (east coast) but when I returned ...
customer_reviews.text: A powerful scanner in a small package, I am liking it except for trying to program it. So far I've only been able to use the quick method of zip code and it worked fine in one location (east coast) but when I returned to the Southwest I don't seem to be getting the police channels like I did on the east coast. I cleared out the old channel and downloaded the channels for my new location but I am getting channels I am not much interested in and not the police.
customer_reviews.author: Raphael

customer_reviews.title: a bear to load
customer_reviews.text: I have heard good and bad regarding this scanner. My own experience was entirely negative. This radio is IMPOSSIBLE to program. Even a local expert had trouble and he knows what he's doing, unlike me. I called Whistler regarding my problem but they never returned my call. In all fairness, Uniden will not return your calls either. If you really want to hear the local police/ems/fire traffic and can A. Program this radio yourself or B. Hire someone to program it for you and C. Realize that once programmed, it will have to be updated via your computer every 30 days minimum I say go for it. Too much work for me. Good luck and 73 KA8ZAW
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: awesome scanner.
customer_reviews.text: very good scanner. difficult to program at first but once you learn the system it is very easy. has trouble when trying to decode simulcast (everyradio does) but the new trx-100 is supposed to be way better at this. i guess ill find out when it is released. in the end a really good scanner for smaller citys that dont have a lot of talking on p25 simulcast.
customer_reviews.author: jordan

customer_reviews.title: Didn't like this, Scanner because it's was a pain trying ...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't like this, Scanner because it's was a pain trying to get it Programmed !!! Still is not programmed right, and had to pay to get it done !!!! Very very much not happy with this product !!!!😡😡😡😡😡😡
customer_reviews.author: Robbie Williams

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality.
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a quality scanner, we couldn't be happier than with this choice. The written directions are difficult for a novice to understand but there are many YouTube videos that make programming easy. The batteries are slow to recharge but for home use, it will usually be connected to an AC power supply. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon B. Castle

customer_reviews.title: Scanner functions great!! Crystal clear!!
customer_reviews.text: Scanner functions perfectly. Simple to program manually. I added 20 local agencies in 15 mins no problems at all. Hint: watch the youtube videos and follow step by step. Makes programming so simple. Trying to follow written manual instructions were much more confusing i thought. After watching youtube it’s a simple procedure.
customer_reviews.author: saca17

customer_reviews.title: Good scanner some limitations depending on your county.
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a great scanner, however ... It does not fair well in my county... my County is using simulcast broadcasting on their systems. The TRX-1 unfortunately Doesn’t have the capability to pick up those channels. So I ended up returning and getting the Uniden sds100. With that said the programmming of the whistler was easy and straightforward.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: tech support is useless, ( DON'T buy this product or get your ...
customer_reviews.text: it is really hard to program ,tech support is useless ,( DON'T buy this product or get your money back
customer_reviews.author: Beast

customer_reviews.title: Nice little scanner
customer_reviews.text: First of all you have to know what your doing when manually programming and I did not. I knew this ahead of time tho so I'm not gonna ding it. I did use the radio reference app to download everything and it works perfect for me. I dont need anything fancy so I havent played with any of the features. I have no regrets of buying this yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Great radio for the price and great customer support
customer_reviews.text: The radio works well and they have amazing customer support. Scans very fast through channels and has a lot of personalization options to help differentiate what entity you are listening to. Speaker could be a bit louder and online setup was not nearly as easy as described, at least for me. That is how I know they have great customer support as they remoted in to my computer and set everything up for me. Given Whistler's customer support I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Heard

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner for P25 phase 1 trunking!
customer_reviews.text: Very great scanner! The picture I placed in this review show what the display will show if you have a trunking site programed in wrong. Easy to fix after sending a email to Whistler! Will not let me enter a review for the Trx 1 Scanner I also purchased because the reviews are linked together.
customer_reviews.author: Robert806

customer_reviews.title: VERY happy so far...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this scanner with an after market antenna and the reception is amazing. Great scanner! If I HAD to come up with anything negative to say, it would be (1) the software for the computer is a bit clunky. (2) I REALLY wish they had added a smart charging circuit in the scanner so that it would keep rechargeable batteries topped off while it's plugged in. The 'timed' scheme to charge the internal batteries is just asking for trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Dinsmore

customer_reviews.title: It's a great Scanner with issues with me at least.
customer_reviews.text: Great scanner radio. It could be easier to program if the terms would be like "channel" instead of "Object" and so forth. Too much stuff to figure out. I l just want to enter "frequencies" to listen to. A total "auto" feature would be nice to set all the other stuff or you could do it manually. Otherwise it's a great scanner. I mostly listen to Aviation and/or Railroad "frequencies" I recommend this radio highly if you can figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D. Rasmussen

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Is hard to program. Referring you to the reference radio, i was disappointed you have to pay to get it programmed through computer. However you tube helped. I couldn't have programmed it without their tutorial. Not sure about Bayer life does come with adapter. I would recommend this seems to be a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves this scanner
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband's 67th Birthday, he's been hinting for the past year he'd love to have it. He is really enjoying it and said it wasn't hard to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: 2 Old Texan's

customer_reviews.title: Excellent scanner
customer_reviews.text: excellent reception of trunked signals and clear audio is a plus compared with Uniden. Very sensitive to really weak signals.
customer_reviews.author: L. N. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Not for new scanner user's
customer_reviews.text: if you have worked with scanners before this unit is mid range. I am a Uniden man myself . it took me a while to figure this scanner out. Like memory banks in whistler world called ( OBJECTS ). Is it worth the money ? I can only speak for myself and I would have you say yes I don't regret buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Loyd

customer_reviews.title: probably the best portable  digital scanner but....
customer_reviews.text: great product, but not user-friendly at all(especially if you are new into the radio world), plus the user manual comes only in English (come on what about the rest of the world) and don't get me to start with the pre configurations...(only USA and Canada) the Hardware is a solid 10/10, but the software needs serious rework (4/10 at most)
customer_reviews.author: Wazzaby

customer_reviews.title: Use Caution before buying
customer_reviews.text: The bad reviews are right ! It's almost impossible to program unless you're a tech or someone who is trained. I've had the Scanner for over 24 Hours,I have gotten nothing but static and silence . I'm going to try Radio Reference,I hope that gets some calls.If it doesn't I've spent almost $300 for nothing !! My advice try something other then the Whistler WS 1040 A different Maker and or Model
customer_reviews.author: ashes dad

customer_reviews.title: Do Some Homework Before Scanner Arrives
customer_reviews.text: This is not designed for a novice user and I am a novice user. That said, do some studying prior to your scanner's arrival. Using PSREdit500! and a Radio Reference 180 day subscription to upload the frequencies (objects) into the unit. Have fun. Worth the purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Kurt M Torpey

customer_reviews.title: Multiple Units Just Stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is junk. I have bought 6 of these and at least 4 have just stopped working. They stop picking up any radio signal. Do not recommend at all.
customer_reviews.author: F. Walsh

customer_reviews.title: This is a great scanner!
customer_reviews.text: It took a lot of reading, a bunch of videos, and a few mistakes, but about a week after getting it I'm programming and scanning like a boss. Its was worth the cash! Sounds great, Great reception, 5 by 5! Cheers.
customer_reviews.author: James Leary

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner for NDX receive protocol
customer_reviews.text: The radio is superior to earlier Whistler models, such as the WS1080, especially on vhf audio levels and speaker sound. Purchased it in order to receive vhf Kenwood digital protocol. Whistler has done a great job perfecting this emission capability.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money, picks up what you wanna hear.
customer_reviews.text: This is for the whistler WS1040 . Programming is very easy , battery life is about two days . I recommend rechargeable batteries or just use the wall plugin when your at home. Picks up all police, EMS , fire ...at least for now . Wish the case had some sort of drop resistant cover , maybe a rubber shell . It’s worth the money when you hear the Easter bunny at the mall is getting attacked! Lol
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Setting up the scanner was not very difficult it did take some reading of the manual but after a few tries it really wasn't that
customer_reviews.text: I got the scanner about a month ago. It's been many years since I had a Scanner I was a little bit intimidated by all the new technology. Digital technology trunking scanners. I did a couple months or research and decided on the Whistler it seemed to have the features I wanted and was portable at the same time. Setting up the scanner was not very difficult it did take some reading of the manual but after a few tries it really wasn't that bad. The only thing I can recommend is a better speaker. The sound clarity is sometimes not Crisp otherwise the scanner has been performing as expected.
customer_reviews.author: dieter

customer_reviews.title: need a easy to read manual !!
customer_reviews.text: Hard to program, even with a Computer and Cable with Pro List download, wouldn't down load, had to send to Scanne rmaster to program advanced Pro 25, Motorola 1 n 11, along OKWIN frequencies, have had 4 Police scanner digital, this particular WS 1040 would not download programming Frequencies even with Radio freq updates other than that design is great buttons work as they should as, is a good Scanner, and and once programmed with all info needed will be a great radio to use!
customer_reviews.author: jerry  leitz

customer_reviews.title: Can hear local police now!
customer_reviews.text: Finally we can hear our local police and others locally ! Definitely a learning curve getting this set up, learned from reviewers and reached out to them, that helped us get it set up ! Once we got it set up ! We love it !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Lover

customer_reviews.title: hard to program
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to a local sro officers who is extremely versed, in computors an police equipment and he is having a tuff time programming it, still got it programmed, not real happy as to the difficulty on programming this scanner, buyers make sure its worth ur wait.. o btw, cant review any of the features because I haven't gotten it back yet.. billyk
customer_reviews.author: billy kimball

customer_reviews.title: I got a great deal on this scanner
customer_reviews.text: I got a great deal on this scanner, new in box, almost 50% off MSRP. Came with interface cable and rechargeable battery holder. Somewhat hard to follow instructions, however plenty of help can be found online. Very happy with items performance in my County. Just what I wanted at a great price. You can not go wrong choosing this scanner for your conventional frequency and digital scanning needs.
customer_reviews.author: R. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Not a value for me.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty well made. All functions work good except for receiving apco25 phase 2. Maybe 10% success rate. That's what I bought it for. I moved it to all kinds of areas around me and it did not work. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: john clowers

customer_reviews.title: Battery life in minimal
customer_reviews.text: Got this radio because the local police department switched frequencies. I do not find this to be an easy radio to use, but the most disappointing part is how fast the batteries die. I also have anther brand scanner for other departments and those batteries last all day and more. I had to buy an extra power cord for the car so it's not running on battery while driving.
customer_reviews.author: Terry M. Costigan

customer_reviews.title: Very good scanner
customer_reviews.text: The scanner is great, and tech support was also very helpful guiding me to set it up. What i didn't know was the police in the St. louis area have the signal encrypted, making the scanner almost useless.... I can though receive weather and the fire departments.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Pletcher

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Unless you are a engineering genius trying to programing this will be a waste of your time and money. I was frightened a bit on the previous reviews but figured I was smart enough to figure it out. I gave up and asked a professional radio buddy that works for at& he couldn’t figure it out either. Keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't skimp on quality
customer_reviews.text: Had to return this scanner. After paying to have it programmed (versus buying extra software to do it myself), it would not pick up most frequencies in my area. It was horrible. Had to return it and purchased another scanner at a much higher cost but well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: JJ8675309

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: Does the job to hear analog and P25 conventional and trunking frequencies! Be aware to read the description about what trunking systems this scanner picks up and make sure that your system(s) are compatible. No flaws very easy to program from scanner itself or via computer! Very loud on sound so be careful if you set the volume up all the way. Very pleased and would recommend for BASIC analog and P25 conventional and trunking scanning.
customer_reviews.author: Alej.d.758

customer_reviews.title: Whistler TRX-1
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan of push button volume control, rathered 8t was on top beside the squelch control. Without the programming software, it's difficult. Overall good!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great Trunking Scanner
customer_reviews.text: A good unit. Exactly like the old GRE 500 and radio shack version. Doesn't work for Type II trunking, but I knew that when I got it. I like the Whistler units better than the Unidens.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Todd

customer_reviews.title: Good scanner for the price
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is great...except.... for some reason they made the scanner that it doesn't charge rechargeable batteries... it will only do what's called a maintenance charge... so if you charge the batteries for 12 hours they will only last about an hour... you have to take the batteries out and charge them in a separate battery charger and then reinstall them in order for them to last a day... other than that I love the scanner
customer_reviews.author: christopher smith

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT SCANNER
customer_reviews.text: Excellent scanner! This is my second one. I broke the antenna on my first one, so now I fixed it so it still works, but has to remain stationary. I love the cloning part. When my new one come in the mail, I hooked the two together, and in 8 seconds my new one was programmed the same as the first one. Even all the added features I put in myself transferred over. Highly recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Sven

customer_reviews.title: Use for Racing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scanner for racing because most of the racing body's have gone digital. I use this with a headset to hear the track officials so I can relay information to the drive during the race.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner with overwhelming options
customer_reviews.text: Great scanner with overwhelming options. Definitely follow the advice and join the scanner site and download the scans. It costs a few bucks and you don't have to renew after you have what you need. Makes it much easier.
customer_reviews.author: D. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great product. I found it easy to program even with out PC.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Not so easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a Christmas gift, still have not figured out how to use it...Asked lots of friends for help.still no luck. Past time to return it too... It just sits there in the box. Not a smart purchase. :(
customer_reviews.author: Starr R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Scanner, Charging Does Not Function As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Whistler purchase. Great scanner. My only complaint is that the internal battery charging feature will not fully charge the batteries. I still have to take them out and put them in a charger.
customer_reviews.author: JNL

customer_reviews.title: Purchased For Included NXDX Capability
customer_reviews.text: County sheriff and EMS changed to NXDX over the summer negating the usefulness of my Uniden BC125AT scanner. For $430, a much cheaper option than the Uniden SDS100 where NXDX is an extra cost option over its $650 price. Programming the TRX-1 a bit of a challenge over the simplicity of the Uniden program but doable.
customer_reviews.author: DENNIS N LETOILE

customer_reviews.title: I did spend sometime with this getting it programmed and ...
customer_reviews.text: I did spend sometime with this getting it programmed and understanding the E-Z scan software. Still learning. It does work.
customer_reviews.author: KennyM

customer_reviews.title: Good price,good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Price is very fair compared to other digital scanners and pretty good quality to.
customer_reviews.author: David. Scioscia

customer_reviews.title: Never did work.
customer_reviews.text: The TRX-1 had an error code 1, which was never corrected by customer service. The EZ SCAN software never came with an instruction manual, or any other user guide, making the radio useless. After a month talking to customer service without any success, I took the radio apart, destroyed it's circuit boards, and tossed it in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: David O. Shull

customer_reviews.title: Great price and my husband loves it.
customer_reviews.text: My husband had been looking for something like this for a long time. Happy about the price and he enjoys listening to this in the evening to decompress after working a 12 hour shift. Amazing how good the reception is!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine S.

customer_reviews.title: Very dissatisfied..
customer_reviews.text: I spent a lot of time trying to program the WS1040 and the only thing I achieved was a lot of frustration, not user friendly at all. I finally broke down and took it to a computer specialist, they were able to get closer but could not finish the programming. Right now I have nothing more than an expensive paper weight, would not recommend for anybody..
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great for experts I assume.
customer_reviews.text: Says just put in zip code and youre all set. Not true. Read many forum discussions and all responses are by people who are well versed in radio and trunking communications. Instructions are literally just definitions that don't tell you how to apply setting. Software is old dos programming and is geared toward advanced knowledge. Sent back.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS THE ONE!! GREAT SCANNER!
customer_reviews.text: Don't Hesitate to buy this gem!! Don't let the programming hinder you. There are several easy YouTube videos to walk you through it. I have a handheld Uniden, this one is far superior for the money! You won't be disapointed.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to program
customer_reviews.text: Really like this scanner but getting it programmed has been difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Terri knotts

customer_reviews.title: It can do the job...but nothing more.
customer_reviews.text: Inflexibility not the Whistler is second to none. It's 1990's approach to programming radios really sets it apart from the pack....in a bad way.
customer_reviews.author: Byte

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I found this Whistler WS1040 Handheld Digital Scanner Radio impossible to program, I was disappointed to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: S. Moran

customer_reviews.title: Did not work well
customer_reviews.text: Battery life on the scanner not very good scanner works very well picks up signals very well charger is very cheap
customer_reviews.author: johnny

customer_reviews.title: The best one
customer_reviews.text: Combined with the ease-of-use on the web to set it up, this is the best unit out there for the money. It operates flawlessly and range is more than sufficient for anyone to use.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: I bought this item so that I know what's going on in my area.
customer_reviews.text: I disliked this product because I couldn't figure out how to operate it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Peterson

customer_reviews.title: SOFTWARE PROBLEMS!
customer_reviews.text: VERY DISAPPOINTED IN PRODUCT! DO NOT BUY! Issues with product updating the firmware. Could not download anything.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: Avoid Whistler Scanners
customer_reviews.text: The Whistler EZ Scan software does not have an instruction manual or user guide. It also appears nobody at Whistler knows how to use EZ Scan software to program their scanners. Uniden does not have this problem and is a better choice.
customer_reviews.author: David O. Shull

customer_reviews.title: Read your manual or have it programed for you
customer_reviews.text: Read your manual. Join trx1 yahoo or Fb groups for help
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I can’t tell you how we like it because so far we haven’t been able to program it!!!!! Nothing easy about it!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Kenas

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner for the price!
customer_reviews.text: When we FINALLY received the scanner and had it programmed, it works very well. I was very disappointed in delivery time. It changed from Thurs. to Fri. to Sat. and I finally received it on Monday. NOT impressed with that. Amazon did refund my shipping for the delay in delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis A.

customer_reviews.title: Backlight
customer_reviews.text: Display contrast on my unit was not as good as the one on my Whistler 1080, and backlight not as good overall, even turning up the contrast to maximum, but radio operates fine.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Amazing scanner
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. Sensitive & tracks all the local frequencies I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: J. Goldsmith

customer_reviews.title: Nice scanner but....
customer_reviews.text: Nice scanner but you better know what your doing before you buy. Not for new users
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: British Columbia/Canada
customer_reviews.text: Will not decrypt ECOMM - RCMP or other police in BC/Canada
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended high quality
customer_reviews.text: Ease of use was great as was the quality worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: I'm enjoying my scanner. Programmed it manually. Can't get it to connect with my computer. All signals and calls are loud and clear of the ones I programmed in. Happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Larry Paasch

customer_reviews.title: Listen up for your town!
customer_reviews.text: I like to be informed, this does exactly how I had hoped!
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner for the money!
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is awesome. It has a nice case and look with great power and sound. It picks up everything going on around me and has erry option that I could want. That being said I had to buy $40 programming software because I don't want to spend whatever amount of time would be required to figure that out. The case, although nice, is not very durable, do I felt the need to add a $30 carry case from Radio Shack just to make sure the nice case doesn't get cracked. So, I have an extra $70 wrapped up in extras thus far. No biggie, but very disappointed that the programming software was not included with the scanner.
customer_reviews.author: ninjafly

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product thanks.
customer_reviews.text: No problems at all with this product. I use it everyday.
customer_reviews.author: randall p shadoan

product_meta.title: Whistler WS1040 Handheld Digital Scanner Radio
product_meta.description: Style:Whistler WS1040 Handheld Digital Scanner| Color:BlackThe WS1040 is a handheld digital trunking scanner with Motorola P25 Phase I capabilities. The WS1040 features Object Oriented programming which has often been regarded by users as easy to program and use. Virtual Scanner mode stores 21 various scanner configurations for a total storage capacity of over 38,000 scannable objects. Just as their lower end brother models, this offers a dedicated Skywarn button and Spectrum Sweeper - Quickly sweeps the scanner’s frequency ranges for transmissions from nearby sources. Lock out found frequencies and continue searching in the same band. Free-Form Memory Organization - Allocation of memory dynamically and efficiently as it is needed. This differs from low cost and older scanners that had memory organized in rigid and wasteful memory banks
feature_bullets: Menu Driven Programming with Context Sensitive Help - Each menu item provides a few lines of help text that provide assistance with programming and using the scanner
Scan List-functionality allows you to arrange, group and scan objects according to your preference;Lock-out Function
Skywarn Storm Spotter Functionality - Instant access to frequencies used by storm spotter networks
Digital AGC - Instantly compensates for low user audio levels that are common on digital systems

If you pressed the FIRE icon button it is possible that the frequencies pre-programmed in the scanner do not include your area. These Pre-programmed frequencies are generally common Police/Fire frequencies

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars718 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
